input: Bob is blue. Bob is smart. Charlie is not cold. Charlie is green. Charlie is not nice. Dave is cold. Gary is blue. Gary is cold. Gary is green. Gary is nice. Gary is red. Gary is not smart. If Bob is blue then Bob is white. If something is red and cold then it is green. If something is red and green then it is white. All green, blue things are white. All red, smart things are nice. Blue, nice things are cold. All white, smart things are red. If Dave is nice then Dave is cold. Question: Bob is green.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Blue Bob
axiom T2 : Smart Bob
axiom T3 : ¬ Cold Charlie
axiom T4 : Green Charlie
axiom T5 : ¬ Nice Charlie
axiom T6 : Cold Dave
axiom T7 : Blue Gary
axiom T8 : Cold Gary
axiom T9 : Green Gary
axiom T10 : Nice Gary
axiom T11 : Red Gary
axiom T12 : ¬ Smart Gary

axiom R1 : Blue Bob → White Bob
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Cold x → Green x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Green x → White x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ Blue x → White x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Smart x → Nice x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x ∧ Nice x → Cold x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Smart x → Red x
axiom R8 : Nice Dave → Cold Dave

theorem bob_is_green : Green Bob :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Bob is not green

theorem not_bob_is_green : ¬ Green Bob :=
begin
  intro H,
  have H1 : White Bob := R1 T1,
  have H2 : Red Bob := R7 Bob (and.intro H1 T2),
  have H3 : Green Bob := R2 Bob (and.intro H2 (R6 Bob (and.intro T1 (R5 Bob (and.intro H2 T2))))),
  contradiction,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
